No, it does not require. I tried to do that, =
but found that JUnit 
does not use TestCase instance passed to suite.add() =
method. It just 
direves class name from the instance and them creates a ne=
w one to 
run test. I might be wrong, but I spent pretty much time and fina=

came up with the conslusion above.
